arabicText: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	never	did	We	destroy	a	township	
which	did	not	have	Heralds	of	warning,	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hamne	koi	basti	halāk	na	ki	jise	dar	
sunāne	wāle	na	hoñ

arabicText: ذِكْرَىٰ وَمَا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText: To	advise;	and	We	never	oppress.
romanUrduTranslationText: Naseehat	ke	liye	aur	ham	zulm	nahiñ	karte

arabicText: وَمَا تَنَزَّلَتْ بِهِ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينُ
englishTranslationText:
And	this	Qur’an	was	not	brought	down	by	
the	devils.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	is	Qur’ān	ko	lekar	Shaitān	na	utre

arabicText: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لَهُمْ وَمَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
englishTranslationText: They	are	unworthy	of	it,	nor	can	they	do	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh		is	qābil	nahiñ	aur	na	woh		aisā	kar	
sakte	haiñ

arabicText: إِنَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّمْعِ لَمَعْزُولُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	they	have	been	banished	from	the	
place	of	hearing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	to	sunne	ki	jagāh	se	door	kardiye	
gaye	haiñ

arabicText: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُعَذَّبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	do	not	worship	another	deity	
along	with	Allah,	for	you	will	be	punished
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Allah	ke	siwā	doosrā	khudā	na	pooj	ke	
tujh	par	áƶāb	hogā

arabicText: وَأَنذِرْ عَشِيرَتَكَ ٱلْأَقْرَبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad	–	peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him),	warn	your	
closest	relatives.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	Mahboob	apne	qareeb	tar	rishte	
dāroñ	ko	darāo

arabicText: وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	spread	your	wing	of	mercy	for	the	
believers	following	you.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apni	Rahmat	kā	bāzu	bichāo	apne	
pairo	(Tab’e)	Musalmānoñ	ke	liye

arabicText: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌۭ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	if	they	do	not	obey	you,	then	say,	
“Indeed	I	am	unconcerned	with	what	you	
do.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	agar	woh	tumhārā	hukm	na	māne	to	
farmā	do	maiñ	tumhāre	kāmoñ	se	be
‘ilāqa	(La	t’alluq)	huñ

arabicText: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
And	rely	upon	(Allah)	the	Almighty,	the	
Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	uspar	bharosa	karo	jo	Izzat	wālā	
mehar	wālā	hai

arabicText: ٱلَّذِى يَرَىٰكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
englishTranslationText: Who	watches	you	when	you	stand	up.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	tumheiñ	dekhtā	hai	jab	tum	khade	hote	
ho

arabicText: وَتَقَلُّبَكَ فِى ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	watches	your	movements	among	
those	who	prostrate	in	prayer.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Namāziyoñ	meiñ	tumhāre	daure	ko

arabicText: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	only	He	is	the	All	Hearing,	the	All	Knowing
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	wohi	suntā	jāntā	hai

arabicText: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينُ
englishTranslationText: Shall	I	inform	you	upon	whom	do	the	devils	descend?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	maiñ	tumheiñ	batā	duñ	ke	kis	par	utarte	haiñ	shaitān?

arabicText: تَنَزَّلُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText: They	descend	on	every	great	accuser,	extreme	sinner.	(The	magicians)
romanUrduTranslationText: Utarte	haiñ	har	bade	bohtān	wāle	gunahgār	par

arabicText: يُلْقُونَ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ كَـٰذِبُونَ
englishTranslationText: The	devils	convey	upon	them	what	they	heard,	but	most	of	them	are	liars
romanUrduTranslationText: Shaitān	apni	suni	huyi		unpar	dālte	haiñ	aur	un	meiñ	aksar	jhute	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱلشُّعَرَآءُ يَتَّبِعُهُمُ ٱلْغَاوُۥنَ
englishTranslationText: And	the	astray	follow	the	poets.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	shā’iroñ	ki	pairwi	gumrāh	karte	haiñ

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى كُلِّ وَادٍۢ يَهِيمُونَ
englishTranslationText: Did	you	not	see	that	they	keep	wandering	in	every	valley?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	tum	ne	na	dekhā	ke	woh	har	nāle	meiñ	sar	gardāñ	phirte	haiñ

arabicText: وَأَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ مَا لَا يَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	they	speak	what	they	do	not	do?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh		kahte		hai	jo	nahiñ	karte

arabicText: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًۭا وَٱنتَصَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَىَّ مُنقَلَبٍۢ يَنقَلِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Except	those	who	believed	and	did	good	deeds,	and	profusely	remembered	Allah,	and	took	
revenge	after	they	had	been	wronged	*;	and	soon	the	unjust	will	come	to	know	upon	which	side	
they	will	be	overturned	**.	(*	The	Muslim	poets	who	praise	Allah	and	the	Prophet.	**	The	
disbelievers	will	be	punished.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	woh		jo	Imān	laye	aur	acche	kām	kiye	aur	ba-kasrat	Allah	ki	yād	ki	aur	badla	liyā	b’ad		iske	
ke	unpar	zulm	huā	aur	ab	jānā	chāhte	haiñ	ƶalim	ke	kis	karwat	par	paltā	khāyeiñge

arabicText: طسٓ ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْقُرْءَانِ وَكِتَابٍۢ مُّبِينٍ
englishTranslationText:
Ta-Seen*;	these	are	verses	of	the	Qur’an	and	
the	clear	Book.	(*Alphabets of the Arabic 
language; Allah and to whomever He 
reveals, know their precise meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ta-Seen*;	Yeh	Āyateiñ	haiñ	Qur’ān	aur	
Raushan	Kitāb	ki.	(*Arabi zabān ke Huroof 
jinke Ma’āni Allah aur Jis par Allah Ta’āla ne 
Inko Nazil Farmaya Wahi Janta hai.)

arabicText: هُدًۭى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: A	guidance	and	glad	tidings	for	the	believers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hidāyat	aur	Khush	khabri	Imān	wāloñ	ko.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	keep	the	prayer	established	and	
pay	the	charity	and	are	certain	of	the	
Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	Namāz	barpā	rakhte	haiñ,	aur	Zakāt	
dete	haiñ	aur	woh	Ākhirat	par	yaqeen	rakhte	
haiñ

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	do	not	believe	in	the	Hereafter	-	
We	have	made	their	deeds	seem	good	to	
them,	so	they	are	astray.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	Ākhirat	par	Imān	nahiñ	lāte	Hamne	
unke	koutak	(Bure	ā’amāl)	unki	nigāh	meiñ	
bhale	kar	dikhāye	haiñ

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْأَخْسَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	they	for	whom	is	the	worst	punishment,	
and	they	will	be	the	greatest	losers	in	the	
Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	woh	bhatak	rahe	haiñ	yeh	woh	haiñ	jinke	
liye	burā	ázāb		hai	aur	yehi	Ākhirat	meiñ	sabse	
badhkar	nuqsān	meiñ.

arabicText: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى ٱلْقُرْءَانَ مِن لَّدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	you	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	are	
taught	the	Qur’an	from	the	Wise,	the	All	
Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	tum	Qur’ān	sikhāye	jāte	ho	Hikmat	
wāle	Ilm	wāle	ki	taraf	se

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِۦٓ إِنِّىٓ ءَانَسْتُ نَارًۭا سَـَٔاتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ ءَاتِيكُم بِشِهَابٍۢ قَبَسٍۢ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
(Remember)	when	Moosa	said	to	his	wife,	“I	
have	sighted	a	fire;	I	will	soon	bring	its	news	to	
you,	or	bring	for	you	an	ember	from	it	so	that	
you	may	warm	yourselves.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jabke	Mūsā	ne	Apni	ghar	wāli	se	kahā:	mujhe	ek	
āg	nazar	padi	hai	án-qareeb	maiñ	tumhāre	pās	
uski	koi	khabar	lātā	huñ	yā	us	meiñ	se	koi	
chamakti	chingāri	lāoñgā	ke	tum	tāpo

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهَا نُودِىَ أَنۢ بُورِكَ مَن فِى ٱلنَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	he	reached	it,	it	was	proclaimed,	
“Blessed	is	he	who	is	in	the	location	of	the	fire	
(Moosa)	and	those	who	are	close	to	it	(the	
angels);	and	Purity	is	to	Allah,	the	Lord	Of	The	
Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	āag	ke	pās	āayā	nidā	ki	gayi	ke	barkat	
diyā	gayā	woh	jo	is	āag	ki	jalwa	gāh	maiñ	hai	
yāni	Mūsā	aur	jo	iske	āas	pās	haiñ	y’ani	Firishte		
aur	pāki	hai	Allah	ko	jo	Rab	hai	sāre	jahān	kā.

arabicText: يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
“O	Moosa,	I	am	indeed,	in	truth,	Allah	the	
Almighty,	the	Wise.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey		Mūsā		bāt	yeh	hai	ke	maiñ	hi	huñ	Allah	izzat	
wālā	hikmat	wālā

arabicText: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَآنٌّۭ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًۭا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفْ إِنِّى لَا يَخَافُ لَدَىَّ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	put	down	your	staff”;	so	when	he	saw	it	writhing	like	a	serpent,	he	turned	moving	away	without	
looking	back;	We	said,	“O	Moosa,	do	not	fear;	indeed	the	Noble	Messengers	do	not	fear	in	My	presence.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apnā		Ásā	dāl	de	phir	Mūsā	ne	usey	dekhā	
lehrātā	huā	goyā	sāñp	hai	peeth	pher	kar	chalā	aur	murd	kar	na	dekhā	hamne	farmāyā	aey	Mūsā	dar	nahiñ	
be-shak	mere	huzoor	Rasooloñ	ko	khauf	nahiñ	hotā

arabicText: إِلَّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْنًۢا بَعْدَ سُوٓءٍۢ فَإِنِّى غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ ١١
englishTranslationText:
“Except	the	one	*	who	does	injustice	and	then	after	evil	changes	it	for	virtue	–	then	indeed	I	am	Oft	
Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.”	(Other	than	the	Prophets.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ!	Jo	koi	ziyādati	kare	phir	burāyi	ke	b’ad		bhalāyi	se	badle	to	be-shak	mai	bakash	ne	wālā	maherbān	huñ

arabicText: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِى جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوٓءٍۢ ۖ فِى تِسْعِ ءَايَـٰتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًۭا فَـٰسِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	put	your	hand	inside	your	armpit	-	it	will	come	out	shining	white,	not	due	to	any	illness;	a	sign	
among	the	nine	signs	towards	Firaun	and	his	people;	they	are	indeed	a	lawless	nation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apnā	hāth	apne	girebān	dāl	niklegā	safed	chamaktā	be-áib	nav	nishāniyoñ	meiñ	fir’aun	aur	uski	Qaom	
ki	taraf		be-shak	woh		be	hukm	log	haiñ

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْهُمْ ءَايَـٰتُنَا مُبْصِرَةًۭ قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText: Then	when	Our	enlightening	signs	came	to	them,	they	said,	“This	is	clear	magic.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	jab	hamāri	nishāniyāñ	āakheiñ	kholti	unke	pās	āyiñ		bole:	yeh	to	sareeh	jādu	hai

arabicText: وَجَحَدُوا۟ بِهَا وَٱسْتَيْقَنَتْهَآ أَنفُسُهُمْ ظُلْمًۭا وَعُلُوًّۭا ۚ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	denied	them	-	whereas	in	their	
hearts	they	were	certain	of	them	-	due	to	
injustice	and	pride;	therefore	see	what	
sort	of	fate	befell	the	mischievous!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unke	munkir	huye	aur	unke	diloñ	
meiñ	unkā	yaqeen	thā	zulm	aur	takabbur	
se	to	dekho	kaisā	anjām	huā	fasādiyoñ	kā

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا دَاوُۥدَ وَسُلَيْمَـٰنَ عِلْمًۭا ۖ وَقَالَا ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍۢ مِّنْ عِبَادِهِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	indeed	bestowed	great	knowledge	
to	Dawud	and	Sulaiman;	and	they	both	
said,	“All	praise	is	to	Allah,	Who	bestowed	
us	superiority	over	many	of	His	believing	
bondmen.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hamne	Dāwood	aur	Sulaimān		
ko	badā	'ilm	áṭa	farmāyā	aur	dono	ne	kahā	
sab	khubiyāñ	Allah	ko	jisne	hameiñ	apne	
bahut	se	Imān	wāle	bandoñ	par	fazeelat	
bakhshi

arabicText: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيْمَـٰنُ دَاوُۥدَ ۖ وَقَالَ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ عُلِّمْنَا مَنطِقَ ٱلطَّيْرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلْفَضْلُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
englishTranslationText:
And	Sulaiman	became	Dawud’s	heir;	and	
he	said,	“O	people,	we	have	indeed	been	
taught	the	language	of	birds,	and	have	
been	given	from	all	things;	this	surely	is	a	
manifest	favour.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Sulaimān	Dāwood	kā	jānasheen	huā	
aur	kahā:	aey	logoñ	hameiñ	parindoñ	ki	
boli	sikhāyi	gayi	aur	har	cheez	meiñ	se	
hamko	áṭa	huā	be-shak	yehi	zāhir	fazl	hai

arabicText: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيْمَـٰنَ جُنُودُهُۥ مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ وَٱلطَّيْرِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	assembled	together	for	Sulaiman	
were	his	armies	of	jinns	and	men,	and	of	
birds	–	so	they	had	to	be	restricted.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jam’ā	kiye	gaye	Sulaimān	ke	liye	uske	
lashkar	jinoñ	aur	ādmiyoñ	aur	parindoñ	se	
to	woh	roke	jāte	they

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَتَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ وَادِ ٱلنَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌۭ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّمْلُ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ مَسَـٰكِنَكُمْ لَا يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَـٰنُ وَجُنُودُهُۥ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Until	when	they	came	to	the	valley	of	the	
ants,	a	she	ant	exclaimed,	“O	ants,	enter	
your	houses	–	may	not	Sulaiman	and	his	
armies	crush	you,	unknowingly.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yahāñ	tak	ke	jab	chyiuñtiyoñ	ke	nāle	par	
āye	ek	chiyuñti	boli:	Aey		chiyuñtiyoñ	apne	
gharoñ	meiñ	chali	jāo	tumheiñ	kuchal	na	
dāleiñ	Sulaimān	aur	unke	lashkar	be	
khabri	meiñ.

arabicText: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكًۭا مِّن قَوْلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِىٓ أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَىَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَٰلِدَىَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا تَرْضَىٰهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِى بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِى عِبَادِكَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	therefore	smiled	beamingly	at	her	
speech*,	and	submitted,	“My	Lord,	bestow	
me	guidance	so	that	I	thank	you	for	the	
favour	which	You	bestowed	upon	me	and	
my	parents,	and	so	that	I	may	perform	the	
good	deeds	which	please	You,	and	by	Your	
mercy	include	me	among	Your	bondmen	who	are	worthy	of	Your	proximity.”	(Prophet	Sulaiman	
heard	the	voice	of	the	she	ant	from	far	away.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	uski	bāt	se	muskurā	kar	hañsā	aur	árz		
ki:	Aey		mere	Rab	mujhe	taufeeq	de	ke	
maiñ	shukr	karuñ	tere	ehsān	kā	jo	tune	
mujh	par	aur	mere	māñ	bāp	par	kiye	aur	yeh	ke	maiñ	woh	bhalā	kām	karuñ	jo	tujhe	pasand	āaye	
aur	mujhe	apni	Rahmat	se	apne	un	bandoñ	meiñ	shāmil	kar	jo	tere	Qurb-e-khās	ke	sazāwār	haiñ.

arabicText: وَتَفَقَّدَ ٱلطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِىَ لَآ أَرَى ٱلْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْغَآئِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	he	surveyed	the	birds	–	he	therefore	said,	“What	is	to	me	that	I	do	not	see	the	Hudhud	
(hoopoe),	or	is	he	really	absent?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	parindoñ	kā	jaiza	liyā	to	bolā:	Mujhe	kyā	huā	ke	maiñ	hud-hud	ko	nahiñ	dekhtā	ya	woh		
wāqayi	hāzir	nahiñ.

arabicText: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُۥ عَذَابًۭا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لَأَا۟ذْبَحَنَّهُۥٓ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّى بِسُلْطَـٰنٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: “I	will	indeed	punish	him	severely	or	slay	him,	or	he	must	bring	to	me	some	clear	evidence.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Zaroor	maiñ	usey		sakht	áƶāb		karuñgā	ya	zibah	karuñ	duñgā	yā	koi	raushan	sanad	mere	pās	lāye

arabicText: فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍۢ فَقَالَ أَحَطتُ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِۦ وَجِئْتُكَ مِن سَبَإٍۭ بِنَبَإٍۢ يَقِينٍ
englishTranslationText:
So	Hudhud	did	not	stay	absent	for	long,	and	presenting	himself	submitted,	“I	have	witnessed	a	
matter	that	your	majesty	has	not	seen,	and	I	have	brought	definite	information	to	you	from	the	
city	of	Saba.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	hud-hud	kuch	ziyada	der	na	thahrā	aur	ākar	árz	ki	ke	maiñ	woh	bāt	dekh	āyā	huñ	jo	huzoor	
ne	na	dekhi	aur	maiñ	shahr-e-Sabā	se	huzoor	ke	pās	ek	yaqeeni	khabar	lāyā	huñ.

arabicText: إِنِّى وَجَدتُّ ٱمْرَأَةًۭ تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“I	have	seen	a	woman	who	rules	over	
them,	and	she	has	been	given	from	all	
things,	and	she	has	a	mighty	throne.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Maiñ	ne	ek	aurat	dekhi	ke	unpar	bādshāhi	
kar	rahi	hai	aur	usey	har	cheez	meiñ	se	
milā	hai	aur	uskā	badā	takht	hai

arabicText: وَجَدتُّهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“I	found	her	and	her	nation	prostrating	
before	the	sun	instead	of	Allah,	and	Satan	
has	made	their	deeds	seem	good	to	them	
thereby	preventing	them	from	the	Straight	
Path	-	so	they	do	not	attain	guidance.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Maiñ	ne	usey	aur	uski	Qaom	ko	pāyā	ke	
Allah	ko	chord	kar	suraj	ko	sajda	karte	
haiñ	aur	shaitān	ne	unke	a’amāl	unki	nigāh	
meiñ	sañwar	kar	unko	seedhi	rāh	se	rok	
diyā	to	woh	rāh	nahiñ	pāte

arabicText: أَلَّا يَسْجُدُوا۟ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى يُخْرِجُ ٱلْخَبْءَ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Why	do	they	not	prostrate	to	Allah,	Who	
brings	forth	the	things	hidden	in	the	
heavens	and	the	earth,	and	knows	all	what	
you	hide	and	all	what	you	disclose?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyuñ	nahiñ	Sajda	karte	Allah	ko	jo	nikāltā	
hai	āsmānoñ	aur	zameen	chupi	chizeñ	aur	
jāntā	hai	jo	kuch	tum	chupāte	ho	aur	zāhir	
karte	ho

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ ۩‏
englishTranslationText:
“Allah	-	there	is	no	True	God	except	Him,	
the	Owner	of	the	Great	Throne.”	
(Command	of	Prostration	#	8)
romanUrduTranslationText:
ALLAH	hai	ke	uske	siwā	koi	sachchā	
M’abood	nahiñ	woh	bade	Ársh	kā	mālik	
hai.	(Sajde	ka	hukm	#8)

arabicText: ۞ قَالَ سَنَنظُرُ أَصَدَقْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Sulaiman,	“We	shall	now	see	whether	
you	spoke	the	truth	or	are	among	the	
liars.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sulaimān	ne	farmāyā:	ab	ham	dekheñ	ge	ke	
tune	sach	kahā	ya	tu	jhootoñ	meiñ	hai

arabicText: ٱذْهَب بِّكِتَـٰبِى هَـٰذَا فَأَلْقِهْ إِلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا يَرْجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Go	with	this	letter	of	mine	and	drop	it	
upon	them	-	then	move	aside	from	them	
and	see	what	they	answer	in	return.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Merā	yeh	farmān	le	jā	kar	unpar	dāl	phir	
unse	alag	hat	kar	dekh	ke	woh	kyā	jawāb	
dete	haiñ

arabicText: قَالَتْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ إِنِّىٓ أُلْقِىَ إِلَىَّ كِتَـٰبٌۭ كَرِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
The	woman	said,	“O	chieftains,	indeed	a	
noble	letter	has	been	dropped	upon	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	aurat	boli:	Aey		sardāro	be-shak	meri	
taraf	ek	izzat	wālā	khat	dālā	gayā

arabicText: إِنَّهُۥ مِن سُلَيْمَـٰنَ وَإِنَّهُۥ بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
“Indeed	it	is	from	Sulaiman,	and	it	is	
(begins)	with	‘Allah	-	beginning	with	the	
name	of	-	the	Most	Gracious,	the	Most	
Merciful.’	”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	woh	Sulaimān	ki	taraf	se	hai	aur	
be-shak	woh	Allah	ke	nām	se	hai	jo	nihāyat	
maherbān	Rahem	wālā

arabicText: أَلَّا تَعْلُوا۟ عَلَىَّ وَأْتُونِى مُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“That	‘Do	not	wish	eminence	above	me,	
and	present	yourselves	humbly	to	me,	
with	submission.’	”
romanUrduTranslationText: Yeh	ke	mujh	par	bulandi	na	chāho	aur	gardan	rakhte	mere	huzoor	hāzir	ho

arabicText: قَالَتْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ أَفْتُونِى فِىٓ أَمْرِى مَا كُنتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ
englishTranslationText:
She	said,	“O	chieftains,	advise	me	in	this	matter	of	mine;	I	do	not	give	a	final	decision	until	you	
are	present	with	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Boli:	Aey	sardāro	mere	is	mu’āmle	meiñ	mujhe	rāye	do	maiñ	kisi	mu’āmle	meiñ	koi	qat’i	faisla	
nahiñ		karti	jab	tak	tum	mere	pās	hāzir	na	ho

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ نَحْنُ أُو۟لُوا۟ قُوَّةٍۢ وَأُو۟لُوا۟ بَأْسٍۢ شَدِيدٍۢ وَٱلْأَمْرُ إِلَيْكِ فَٱنظُرِى مَاذَا تَأْمُرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“We	possess	great	strength	and	are	great	warriors,	and	the	decision	is	yours,	therefore	
consider	what	you	will	command.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh		bole:	ham	zor	wāle	aur	badi	sakht	ladāyi	wāle	haiñ	aur	ikhtiyār	terā	hai	tu	nazar	kar	ke	kyā	
hukm	deti	hai

arabicText: قَالَتْ إِنَّ ٱلْمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُوا۟ قَرْيَةً أَفْسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوٓا۟ أَعِزَّةَ أَهْلِهَآ أَذِلَّةًۭ ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
She	said,	“Indeed	the	kings,	when	they	enter	a	township,	destroy	it	and	disgrace	its	honourable	
people;	and	this	is	what	they	do.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Boli:	be-shak	bādshāh	jab	kisi	basti	meiñ	dākhil	hote	haiñ	usey	tabāh	kardete	haiñ	aur	uske	izzat	
wāloñ	ko	zaleel	aur	aisā	hi	karte	haiñ

arabicText: وَإِنِّى مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِم بِهَدِيَّةٍۢ فَنَاظِرَةٌۢ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
englishTranslationText: “And	I	shall	send	a	present	to	them,	then	see	what	reply	the	envoys	bring.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	main	unki	taraf	ek	tohfā	bhejne	wāli	huñ	phir	dekhuñgi	ke	Elchi	kyā	jawāb	lekar	palte

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ سُلَيْمَـٰنَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٍۢ فَمَآ ءَاتَىٰنِۦَ ٱللَّهُ خَيْرٌۭ مِّمَّآ ءَاتَىٰكُم بَلْ أَنتُم بِهَدِيَّتِكُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	the	envoy	came	to	Sulaiman,	he	
said,	“Are	you	helping	me	with	wealth?	
What	Allah	has	bestowed	upon	me	is	
better	than	what	He	has	given	you;	rather	
it	is	you	who	are	delighted	at	your	gift.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	woh	Sulaimān	ke	pās	āayā	farmāyā	
kya	māl	se	meri	madad	karte	ho	to	jo	
mujhe	Allah	ne	diyā	woh	behtar	hai	usse	jo	
tumheiñ	diyā	balki	tumhiñ	apne	tohfe	par	
khush	hote	ho

arabicText: ٱرْجِعْ إِلَيْهِمْ فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنُودٍۢ لَّا قِبَلَ لَهُم بِهَا وَلَنُخْرِجَنَّهُم مِّنْهَآ أَذِلَّةًۭ وَهُمْ صَـٰغِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Go	back	to	them	–	so	we	shall	indeed	come	
upon	them	with	an	army	they	cannot	fight,	
and	degrading	them	shall	certainly	drive	
them	out	from	that	city,	so	they	will	be	
humiliated.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Palat	jā	unki	taraf	to	zaroor	ham	unpar	
woh	lashkar	lāyeiñ	ge	jinki	unheiñ	tāqat	na	
hogi	aur	zaroor	ham	unko	us	shaher	se	
zaleel	karke	nikāl	deñge	yuñ	ke	woh	past	
hoñge

arabicText: قَالَ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ أَيُّكُمْ يَأْتِينِى بِعَرْشِهَا قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتُونِى مُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Sulaiman,	“O	court	members,	which	
one	of	you	can	bring	me	her	throne	before	
they	come	humbled	in	my	presence?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sulaimān	ne	farmāya	aey	darbāriyo	tum	
meiñ	kaun	hai	ke	woh	us	ka	takht	mere	Pās	
le	āye	qabl	iske	ki	woh	mere	huzoor	muti’a	
hokar	Hazir	hoñ

arabicText: قَالَ عِفْرِيتٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن تَقُومَ مِن مَّقَامِكَ ۖ وَإِنِّى عَلَيْهِ لَقَوِىٌّ أَمِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
An	extremely	evil	jinn	said,	“I	will	bring	it	
in	your	presence	before	you	disperse	the	
assembly;	and	I	am	indeed	strong	and	
trustworthy	upon	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ek	badā	khabees	Jin	bolā	maiñ	woh	takht	
huzoor	meiñ	hāzir	kar	duñgā	qabal	iske	ke	
huzoor	ijlās	barkhāst	kareiñ	aur	maiñ	be
shak	ispar	quwwat	wālā	amānat	dār	hooñ

arabicText: قَالَ ٱلَّذِى عِندَهُۥ عِلْمٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْكَ طَرْفُكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهُ مُسْتَقِرًّا عِندَهُۥ قَالَ هَـٰذَا مِن فَضْلِ رَبِّى لِيَبْلُوَنِىٓ ءَأَشْكُرُ أَمْ أَكْفُرُ ۖ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبِّى غَنِىٌّۭ كَرِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Said	one	who	had	knowledge	of	the	Book,	
“I	will	bring	it	in	your	majesty’s	presence	
before	you	bat	your	eyelid”;	then	when	he	
saw	it	set	in	his	presence*,	Sulaiman	said,	
“This	is	of	the	favours	of	my	Lord;	so	that	
He	may	test	me	whether	I	give	thanks	or	
am	ungrateful;	and	whoever	gives	thanks	
only	gives	thanks	for	his	own	good;	and	
whoever	is	ungrateful	–	then	indeed	my	
Lord	is	the	Independent	(Not	Needing	
Anything),	the	Owner	Of	All	Praise.”	(A	
miracle	which	occurred	through	one	of	
Allah’s	friends.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ne	árz	ki	jiske	pās	kitāb	ka	'ilm	tha	ke	
maiñ	usey	huzoor	meiñ	hāzir	kar	dooñga	
ek	pal	mārne	se	pehle	phir	jab	Sulaimān	ne	
us	takht	ko	apne	pās	rakha	dekha	kaha	yeh	
mere	Rab	ke	fazl	se	hai	tāke	mujhe	āzmāye	
ke	maiñ	shukr	karta	hooñ	ya	na-shukri	aur	
jo	shukr	kare	woh	apne	bhale	ko	shukr	
karta	hai	aur	jo	na	shukri	kare	to	mera	Rab	
be-parwah	hai	sab	khoobiyoñ	wāla.	
 Sulaimān	ne	hukm	diya	aurat	ka	takht

arabicText: قَالَ ٱلَّذِى عِندَهُۥ عِلْمٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْكَ طَرْفُكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهُ مُسْتَقِرًّا عِندَهُۥ قَالَ هَـٰذَا مِن فَضْلِ رَبِّى لِيَبْلُوَنِىٓ ءَأَشْكُرُ أَمْ أَكْفُرُ ۖ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبِّى غَنِىٌّۭ كَرِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Said	one	who	had	knowledge	of	the	Book,	
“I	will	bring	it	in	your	majesty’s	presence	
before	you	bat	your	eyelid”;	then	when	he	
saw	it	set	in	his	presence*,	Sulaiman	said,	
“This	is	of	the	favours	of	my	Lord;	so	that	
He	may	test	me	whether	I	give	thanks	or	
am	ungrateful;	and	whoever	gives	thanks	
only	gives	thanks	for	his	own	good;	and	
whoever	is	ungrateful	–	then	indeed	my	
Lord	is	the	Independent	(Not	Needing	
Anything),	the	Owner	Of	All	Praise.”	(A	
miracle	which	occurred	through	one	of	
Allah’s	friends.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ne	árz	ki	jiske	pās	kitāb	ka	'ilm	tha	ke	
maiñ	usey	huzoor	meiñ	hāzir	kar	dooñga	
ek	pal	mārne	se	pehle	phir	jab	Sulaimān	ne	
us	takht	ko	apne	pās	rakha	dekha	kaha	yeh	
mere	Rab	ke	fazl	se	hai	tāke	mujhe	āzmāye	
ke	maiñ	shukr	karta	hooñ	ya	na-shukri	aur	
jo	shukr	kare	woh	apne	bhale	ko	shukr	
karta	hai	aur	jo	na	shukri	kare	to	mera	Rab	
be-parwah	hai	sab	khoobiyoñ	wāla.

arabicText: قَالَ نَكِّرُوا۟ لَهَا عَرْشَهَا نَنظُرْ أَتَهْتَدِىٓ أَمْ تَكُونُ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Sulaiman,	“Disguise	her	throne	in	front	of	her	so	that	we	may	see	whether	she	finds	the	way	
*	or	becomes	of	those	who	remain	unknowing.”	(*Recognises	her	throne.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sulaimān	ne	hukm	diya	aurat	ka	takht	uske	
sāmne	waza’	badal	kar	begāna	kardo	ke	
hum	dekheiñ	ke woh	rāh	pāti	hai	ya	un	meiñ	hoti	hai	jo	na-wāqif	rahe.
